name: automationName
description: Which automation engine to use

name: platformName
description: Which mobile OS platform to use

name: platformVersion
description: Mobile OS version

name: deviceName
description: The kind of mobile device or emulator to use
help: iPhone Simulator, iPad Simulator, iPhone Retina 4-inch, Android Emulator, Galaxy  S4, etc…. On iOS, this should be one of the valid devices returned by  instruments with instruments -s devices. On Android this capability is  currently ignored.

name: app
description: The absolute local path *or* remote http URL to an .ipa or .apk file, or a  .zip containing one of these. Appium will attempt to install this app  binary on the appropriate device first. Note that this capability is not  required for Android if you specify appPackage and appActivity capabilities  (see below). Incompatible with browserName.

name: browserName
description: Name of mobile web browser to automate. Should be an empty string if  automating an app instead.
help: ‘Safari’ for iOS and ‘Chrome’, ‘Chromium’, or ‘Browser’ for Android

name: newCommandTimeout
description: How long (in seconds) Appium will wait for a new command from the client  before assuming the client quit and ending the session

name: autoLaunch
description: Whether to have Appium install and launch the app automatically. Default  true

name: language
description: (Sim/Emu-only) Language to set for the simulator / emulator

name: locale
description: (Sim/Emu-only) Locale to set for the simulator / emulator

name: udid
description: Unique device identifier of the connected physical device

name: orientation
description: (Sim/Emu-only) start in a certain orientation

name: autoWebview
description: Move directly into Webview context. Default false

name: noReset
description: Don’t reset app state before this session. Default false

name: fullReset
description: (iOS) Delete the entire simulator folder. (Android) Reset app state by  uninstalling app instead of clearing app data. On Android, this will also  remove the app after the session is complete. Default false

name: calendarFormat
description: (Sim-only) Calendar format to set for the iOS Simulator

name: bundleId
description: Bundle ID of the app under test. Useful for starting an app on a real  device or for using other caps which require the bundle ID during test  startup. To run a test on a real device using the bundle ID, you may omit  the ‘app’ capability, but you must provide ‘udid’.

name: udid
description: Unique device identifier of the connected physical device

name: launchTimeout
description: Amount of time in ms to wait for instruments before assuming it hung and  failing the session

name: locationServicesEnabled
description: (Sim-only) Force location services to be either on or off. Default is to  keep current sim setting.

name: locationServicesAuthorized
description: (Sim-only) Set location services to be authorized or not authorized for app  via plist, so that location services alert doesn’t pop up. Default is to  keep current sim setting. Note that if you use this setting you MUST also  use the bundleId capability to send in your app’s bundle ID.

name: autoAcceptAlerts
description: Accept iOS privacy access permission alerts (e.g., location, contacts,  photos) automatically if they pop up. Default is false.

name: nativeInstrumentsLib
description: Use native intruments lib (ie disable instruments-without-delay).

name: nativeWebTap
description: (Sim-only) Enable “real”, non-javascript-based web taps in Safari. Default:  false. Warning: depending on viewport size/ratio this might not accurately  tap an element

name: safariAllowPopups
description: (Sim-only) Allow javascript to open new windows in Safari. Default keeps  current sim setting

name: safariIgnoreFraudWarning
description: (Sim-only) Prevent Safari from showing a fraudulent website warning.  Default keeps current sim setting.

name: safariOpenLinksInBackground
description: (Sim-only) Whether Safari should allow links to open in new windows.  Default keeps current sim setting.

name: keepKeyChains
description: (Sim-only) Whether to keep keychains (Library/Keychains) when appium  session is started/finished

name: localizableStringsDir
description: Where to look for localizable strings. Default en.lproj

name: processArguments
description: Arguments to pass to the AUT using instruments

name: interKeyDelay
description: The delay, in ms, between keystrokes sent to an element when typing.

name: showIOSLog
description: Whether to show any logs captured from a device in the appium logs. Default  false
